revised_title: Negative Electricity Discharge from Hot Calcium and Lime
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the discharge of negative electricity from hot calcium and lime. They found that the negative leak from calcium was much larger than from platinum, and the negative leak from lime was smaller than from calcium. The authors also discovered a curious increase in the negative leak when the cathode was left in a vacuum for some time, which was connected to the appearance of a dark substance on the surface of the platinum strip.
